body: That's great @roonieone!

What we usually do is transferring the repository to this organization and then adding a page on the site. You would still control and maintain the repository, nothing changes :)

Let me know if you like this idea so I can send you an invitation.
Yeah, sounds good to me!
Great, let me know when you accept the invitation ;)
Friendly ping, did you get the invitation? I just resend it, you can accept it here: https://github.com/dracula
Accepted!
Cool! Try transferring to the `dracula` org now.
After you do that, we'll need the instructions to install and enable it on the site.
Not sure how to transfer it. When I try, it says `dracula already has a repository in the dracula/template network`...
Hmm is the remote set to the new repository at `dracula` org ?

Hi @zenorocha and @sleepiejohn, not sure what happened to this previous user and if this is the right place to post this. If it's a problem I'm happy to be redirected to the correct place. üòÑ 

However given the lack of activity on this issue I've made the theme from scratch and made my own repo https://github.com/yougotwill/dracula-coteditor . 

Hopefully this can also be helpful to other cot users out there üëç
@hacknug Looks like you are still active on this repo. Is there any chance we can integrate my repo?
@yougotwill just sent you an invite to join the organization. Once you've joined we can move your repo to it. Let me know if there's anything else you need me to do üëç
Amazing! Thank you so much. üôè

@hacknug I have joined the organisation. I haven"t transferred a repo before so just to confirm. 

1. I go to "transfer ownership" in the settings tab and click the transfer button.
2. Then enter the repo and the organisation name "dracula".
3. Update the remote as mentioned above?

Anything else I need to do. I just want to make sure this goes smoothly üòÜ
Cool @hacknug Will sort it out this evening
@yougotwill can you try now?
@hacknug It works thanks! Will look into making a pr for the website when I have time.
Sounds good. Thanks!
